resources.string: Congratulations and thank you for downloading Proxy Settings! Please read carefully the following introduction to the application and the Android\'s proxy issue.
Proxy Settings is an utility application that provides a set of tools to ease the access and the modification of the proxy configuration into your Android device.

Proxy Settings provides a shortcut for calling a system application called ProxySelector (technically it\'s an Activity) hidden into Android, in order to edit the system\'s proxy configuration of your device. \n\nIn the majority of the Android ROMs the ProxySelector Activity is already present but hidden to the user: what Proxy Settings does is to simply call this existing system utility.

When Google engineers released the first versions of Android, they probably decided to hide the ProxySelector Activity because of the lack of support into both the OS and developers API. Proxy Settings let you change these settings, but we suggest the users to do it very cautiously!

Please remember that uninstalling this application doesn\'t automatically restore the default values of the proxy configuration of your device. You should explicitly clear the proxy configuration before uninstalling Proxy Settings! An improper use of the application could result in a wrong working of the network stack of your device!
About the proxy support on Android

Configuring the proxy doesn\'t mean that all your applications will automatically start to using these settings! This is due to a not easy understandable API for developers. If you are interested in a deeper analysis of this issue, you can find a detailed explanation of the problem and leave your feedbacks/comments on the Android Proxy Project official website:

The project offers also an open source module called Android Proxy Library (APL) that provides to the developers an easy way to access and use the proxy settings in every Android application. So, if you want the Proxy support in your favourite applications, start request this feature to their developers!
Proxy Settings offers to the users a set of tools to check and troubleshoot the selected proxy configuration:

• A Configuration checker: it provides useful status indicators related to the proxy configurationon of your Android device. 

• A URL downloader: it gives you the possibility to download a specific remote resource. 

• A URL browser: it opens a WEB browser page with full proxy support on a selected URL.

Proxy Settings provides an useful section, called Configuration checker that let you check the proxy configuration with useful status indicators, helping understand the issues you may find setting the proxy on your Android device:

• Proxy enabled: Tests if the selected proxy configuration contains a non empty value. 

• Proxy address: Tests if the address of the selected proxy is a valid address. 

• Ping proxy host: Tests if the address of the selected proxy can be reached with a ICMP PING. 

• Web reachability: Tests if it's possible to retrieve an HTTP resource with the current proxy configuration.
I read and accept the terms and conditions

Starting from Android 3.x you should modify the setting only for the current Wi-Fi network.\n\nYou can do it opening with a long press the Wi-Fi network edit dialog, specifying the Proxy settings to Manual, and typing proxy\'s hostname and port.
Proxy Settings is validating your proxy configuration …
It\'s been a while since you are using Proxy Settings. If you enjoy using this app, please take a moment to rate it. Thanks for your support!
